title: Multi-Rotor Drones
details: Where a single-rotor drone looks like a helicopter and is able to maintain flight with a single rotor, these units have several rotors positioned at strategic points on the craft.

title: Fixed-Wing Drones
details: The lack of rotors and fixed-wing style of these drones make them more similar to controllable airplanes rather than the helicopter style of other drones

title: Fixed-Wing Hybrid Drones
details: This types of drone attempt to take the best from fixed-wing and rotor-based designs, making for drones that feature both. A fixed-wing hybrid drone will tend to have a couple rotors

title: Small Drones
details: These drones are strictly recreational and usually cannot perform many of the commercial functions of which some of those other models are capable

title: Micro Drones
details: While smaller drones may mean recreation in the eyes of consumers, for militaries who use drones, micro drones are all business. The most well-known example of this type of drone in action today

title: Tactical Drones
details: These drones are large enough to not be pocket-sized, while still being far smaller than the type used for general combat and larger tasks
